alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 12:42PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...The Mosquito Fork at the Taylor Highway. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...An ice jam on the Mosquito Fork at the Taylor Highway has pushed ice up to the level of the guardrail on the upstream side of the bridge. Flooding as well as large blocks of ice being pushed over bank. Water is flooding the nearby wayside and flooding is occuring up and down stream of the bridge. Water will remain high until the ice jam releases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 AM AKDT, a river gauge and trained weather spotters reported an ice jam remains in place on the Mosquito Fork at the Taylor Highway. Impounding water due to the ice jam is causing high water levels and flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood If you live near or along the Mosquito Fork near the Taylor Highway Bridge stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
